100.heading: Eyes.
100.title: Ray
100.author: Akihito Yoshitomi presents ; translator, Haruka Kaneko-Smith.
notes: Originally published in Japan: 2003- .

Summary (from OCLC): Ray was bred and raised to be a living, breathing organ donor. After her own eyes were taken from her, a stranger bestows upon her the gift of sight and something extra - X-Ray vision! Ten years later, Ray works as a nurse and moonlights as an underground medical doctor performing off-the-book medical procedures. But her daily routine is interrupted by a chance encounter with an old friend that triggers Ray's memories of her hellish childhood. Ray will begin a search that will lead her back to the people who stole her eyes and her childhood!

137.heading: Eyes Closed.
137.title: Dancing with Your Eyes Closed
137.author: Joe Zabel, Gary Dumm ; introduction by Harvey Pekar.
notes: Summary: "Steve Morton is a morose loner who embarks on an odyssey of the heart, staking his hopes on a new age dance group that promises to be something more. Eyes closed, he navigates the rocky shores of art, religion and sexuality, and discovers within himself a wellspring of vivid inspiration. But with his eyes open, he recognizes the truth about the people with whom he dances."

243.heading: Ezra.
243.title: "He Wanted to Finish Those Inventory Sheets"
